meanings.definition: To dip lightly or quickly into a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She was dibbing her cookie into the milk.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys dibbing his fries into ketchup.
meanings.sent3: The cat was dibbing its paw into the fishbowl playfully.
meanings.sent4: The artist was dibbing her brush into the paint with precision.
meanings.sent5: The child giggled while dibbing her toes into the cool water.

meanings.definition: To make a small hole or indentation.
meanings.sent1: He was dibbing the pencil into the paper to create a pattern.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was dibbing the nail into the wood carefully.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was dibbing the ground looking for hidden nuts.
meanings.sent4: The rain was dibbing the soil, leaving tiny craters in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor was dibbing the clay to form intricate designs.

meanings.definition: A quick, light touch or poke.
meanings.sent1: She felt a dibbing on her shoulder and turned around.
meanings.sent2: The child gave the puppy a playful dibbing on its nose.
meanings.sent3: The dibbing on the door made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His dibbing on the keyboard was fast and precise.
meanings.sent5: The dibbing of raindrops on the window created a soothing rhythm.
